info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 1:57AM CDT until August 03 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN CLAY COUNTY... At 157 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Xenia. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 3 hours. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flora, Xenia and Oskaloosa. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 3 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
